result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Further proceedings scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Further proceedings on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Further proceedings on October 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Further proceedings scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:38 PM Defendant Nicholas James Nero in court in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail by video.  Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court for Nicholas James Nero. Atty. Benjamin Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Guza has a pretrial set in the next couple weeks, defendant has a revocation pending.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Further proceedings on September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:39 AM Defendant Nicholas James Nero in court by video from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Jerermy Guza.  Attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Guza motion to dismiss Ct. 6 for lack of probable cause. Court denies motion to dismiss Ct. 6.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas James Nero appeared by video, in custody from the Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Jeremy J Guza appeared by video for Nicholas James Nero. Court reviews motion to dismiss count 6 of the information filed by Atty Guza. Discussion held and motion is held open till next hearing.  Counsel waives reading of complaint. Court enters not guilty plea on behalf of defendant. Counsel as to bail motion. State objects to bail motion. Court denies bail motion.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Clerks review - no appearance required scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 07:30 am.
Further proceedings on July 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.addlTxt:
1:49 PM Defendant Nicholas James Nero in court.  Attorney Jeremy J Guza in court for Nicholas James Nero.  Attorney Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court takes judicial notice of the bail conditions in other counties. Trooper Grigoryev sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Guza, exam by Court. Atty. Guza requests dismissal. Court finds probable cause, binds case over for trial. State files information. Atty. Guza will file motion to dismiss by 6/3. Atty. Guza requests bail motion by 6/3.
Motion hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Motion hearing on June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No dangerous weapons, including firearms or knives.

3:21 PM Defendant Nicholas James Nero appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran. Atty. Matthew Nugent appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD. Def advised of complaint, penalties thereof. Court finds probable cause. Defendant has a probation hold. State recommends $3000 cash bail w/conditions. Court orders $3000 cash bail w/conditions. Defendant does not waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
